name: Courtyard by Marriott Kauai at Coconut Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like everyone else here, the renovation proved loud and distracting. As far as Courtyards go, this seemed to be a nicer one, if it weren't being renovated. It is located right on the beach, not a very spectacular beach but not a bad one. Kapaa is nice because it is only 30 minutes from both Poipu and Hanalei. If you can't decide which you'd like better, stay here.
reviews.title: Renovation annoying, decent price

reviews.text: Hotel under renovation. Restaurant and bar service slow, out of stock on several items. Our room on 4th floor overlooked the main air-conditioner units...NOISY! Wireless in lobby non-existent. The internet in our room required maintenance to come in and run a cable from an outlet behind the TV cabinet across the room to the desk. Could not get the room to cool down. Tiny bathroom. Rooms small by American standards. Bed and linens were excellent. Lots of pillows with fluffy comforters. Convenient location. Our rate was $80/night/2 beds. A surprise $14/night was added on for parking.
reviews.title: ok if you get a good deal on room rate.

reviews.text: I booked the courtyard in Oct; I didn't notice on their site that the hotel would be under renovation. When I went back to the site, indeed I found the announcement labeled, "Hotel Enhancement Timeline," a farily devious title. The construction is problematic. The noise, the standing water (literally puddles), the intermittent (short lived) power outages, and the dust are annoying to say the least. Putting aside the construction, I thought the hotel was just ok. Nothing really special about this hotel, including those areas that have been reconstructed. The staff are ameable, but not nearly on par with Marriott metropolitan hotels in terms of service. I specifically booked and paid for an ocean view room. Technically, they gave me an ocean view room however, it was a corner room with a very small balcony (2 chairs fit, nothing else). Breakfast and appetizers during happy hour were average, not bad, just nothing to write home about. As others have said, forget about communication with the outside world, i.e. internet at this hotel. No wireless in the rooms, however, I was able to connect in the dining area. The parking fee ($14) is ridiculous; clearly, just a money gouging intitiative, much like the "ocean view" room. The room itself was clean and fairly spacious, with a small but adequate bathroom. The bed was not great; again, not on par with other Marriott properties, by any stretch, but I didn't have trouble sleeping either; think, poor support.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the hotel is fine if you can get a room here for under $100 per night, otherwise, you can get much more value for your money at other well reviewed properties on the northeast side of the island.
reviews.title: SleeplessinKapaa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 4 nights at this hotel. The renovations were supposed to be almost completed and when we got there we found that there are major renovations that will take some time to finish. The people we received service from at the bar were friendly and helpful. One problem was there was no in room internet. You had to go to the bar area to get on the internet and the connection there is slow. The worst thing about this place was the bed. The beds looked and felt like they were original to the hotel. My back was hurting by the day we left on the plane back to CA. We had come from a Marriott in Waikola, Hi that had the most comfortable beds ever, to this place where it was like sleeping in our toyhauler bunk. I'm sure that eventually they will work on this area, but I wish it had of been done before we stayed there!
reviews.title: good value for kauai

Relaxing & Comfortable
reviews.text: This hotel is a gem. Understated, quiet and very relaxed. The recent renovations have made it even more attractive. Positives: The pool/jacuzzi/grounds/beach are spacious and lovely. Rooms are large and well-appointed, each with lanai. The staff was very hospitable. Negatives: The bathroom was a bit small. The $14 for nightly parking is steep and unnecessary- the parking lot is large and underused. The beach, while not very swim-able, is quite private. I loved the views to the north - gorgeous mountains and no high-rises to clutter the view. The location on Kauai is perfect, right between the sunny south side and the paradise-like North Coast.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel! The construction/renovation is complete!
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel January 12-19, 2012. We had a "garden view" room and resisted the proffered $50/day upgrade to a beach-view room. Our room was very comfortable, new bed, new mattress, new carpet, new furniture, very clean, great maid service, huge new LG big-screen TV with good cable choices (couldn't find CNBC, though), small balcony with chairs for drinking coffee in the morning. Hotel has a great pool and great bar with good service. We had rental car (necessary on Kauai anyway) and had most meals out. On a rainy day, we ordered lunch from the bar menu and it was quite good. Try the Maui burger with onion rings and a Mai-Tai. On the only evening when we tried to eat at the Hotel restaurant, the food was TERRIBLE. The pork was overcooked, smelled and tasted "old", and was not edible. Management agreed and did take it off our bill, but that evening's dinner was not a satisfactory experience. Except for the evening dining being unacceptable, this was a wonderful experience. There is a great evening restaurant, Hokalau (reservations required), about a two block ride to the other end of the Aleka Loop in the Kauai Beach Resort. Overall, we had a great time using the conveniently located Courtyard as the base.

reviews.title: anal nursing home
reviews.text: This was our first time to Hawaii, I really enjoyed the hotel and amenities. The grounds are beautiful, I don't know what the lobby and rooms looked like before the remodel, but I really like the look, very warm with all the dark wood. The staff was very friendly, we only had dinner food at the hotel restaurant and it was very good. I like the location, off the main road but close to food and shopping. I enjoyed the whale watching from their beach, big hot tub, and pool side fire feature.

aka: Courtyard By Marriott Kauai At Coconut Beach Hotel
description: Centrally located on 10 beachfront acres amid a century-old coconut grove, this deluxe oceanfront resort hotel offers breathtaking views, spacious suites and open-air dining. Centrally located, many movie production crews choose to stay here as it's minutes from anywhere on the island. It's an excellent base to explore and discover the natural beauty that the Garden Island has to offer.
